evidence.text: Where federal education data does exist, the Department has terminated academic researchers’ access to this data in contravention of the congressional mandate to make IES data publicly available.

extracted.value: The Department has terminated academic researchers’ access to federal education data, contravening the congressional mandate to make IES data publicly available.

evidence.text: Plaintiffs and their members, preeminent education scholars and measurement experts, rely on data from IES’s Centers for their research on pressing educational issues, including the National Assessment of Educational Progress (“NAEP”), EDFacts, National Post Secondary Student Aid Survey (“NPSAS”), Educational Longitudinal Studies (“ELS”), Early Childhood Longitudinal Study (“ECLS”), High School Longitudinal Study (“HCLS”), and the Trends in International Mathematics and Science Study (“TIMSS”).

extracted.value: Plaintiffs and their members rely on data from IES’s Centers for research on pressing educational issues, including NAEP, EDFacts, NPSAS, ELS, TIMSS, and other datasets.

evidence.text: On March 20, 2025, President Trump issued an Executive Order directing the Secretary of Education to dismantle the Department.21

extracted.value: The Trump administration issued Executive Order 14242 on March 20, 2025, directing the Secretary of Education to dismantle the Department of Education.

evidence.text: On March 11, 2025, the Department announced a RIF of nearly 50% of its workforce.24

extracted.value: The Department announced a reduction in force of nearly 50% of its workforce on March 11, 2025.

evidence.text: On February 10, 2025, DOGE announced the cancellation of most IES and its Centers’ contracts, constituting over $900 million in contracts.22

extracted.value: The Department canceled contracts with IES and its Centers, amounting to over $900 million in contracts, on February 10, 2025.

evidence.text: On February 10, 2025, the Department announced that all remote restricted‑use data licenses would be terminated effective June 1, 2025, and that it would no longer accept new applications.

extracted.value: The Department announced termination of remote restricted‑use data licenses effective June 1, 2025.

evidence.text: Plaintiffs NAEd’s and NCME’s members rely on EDFacts and NAEP for their work on the Educational Opportunity Project, which is a clearinghouse for national educational test score data. The Educational Opportunity Project uses NAEP and EDFacts data... Plaintiffs NAEd’s and NCME’s members rely on the NPSAS to analyze the distribution of federal financial aid... Plaintiffs NAEd’s and NCME’s members rely on the ECLS for their work on tracking student performance... Plaintiffs NAEd’s and NCME’s members rely on the NCEE’s “What Works Clearinghouse”... Plaintiffs NAEd’s and NCME’s members rely on the National Household Education Survey (NHES)... Plaintiffs NAEd’s and NCME’s members rely on NAEP’s National Indian Education Study (NIES)...

extracted.value: Plaintiffs rely on the National Assessment of Educational Progress (NAEP), Educational Data Facts (EDFacts), National Postsecondary Student Aid Survey (NPSAS), Early Childhood Longitudinal Study (ECLS), Trends in International Mathematics and Science Study (TIMSS), What Works Clearinghouse, National Household Education Survey (NHES), and National Indian Education Study (NIES) datasets for their research and teaching.

evidence.text: The Department’s actions, including the cancellation of contracts and the reduction in force, will limit the availability of significant datasets... Without these contracts, IES and its Centers will not be able to uphold numerous congressional mandates... Plaintiffs’ members will be unable to obtain and utilize the datasets... The Department’s actions will hinder the collection, analysis, and dissemination of these datasets, causing irreparable harm to plaintiffs and their members.

extracted.value: The Department’s actions will hinder the collection, analysis, and dissemination of these datasets, causing irreparable harm to plaintiffs and their members.
